alert.note: Alert for Lower Columbia and I - 5 Corridor in Cowlitz County (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Portland (Northwest Oregon and Southwest Washington)
info.headline: Excessive Heat Watch issued August 12 at 2:05PM PDT until August 17 at 10:00PM PDT by NWS Portland
info.description: ...HEAT ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 11 AM SUNDAY TO 5 AM PDT MONDAY... ...EXCESSIVE HEAT WATCH NOW IN EFFECT FROM LATE SUNDAY NIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY EVENING... * WHAT...For the Heat Advisory, afternoon high temperatures of 92 to 102, with warmest days being Monday and Tuesday. Overnight low temperatures will be in the 60s, but lower to middle 70s in the hills. Some modest relief is possible midweek as temperatures cool off by a few degrees. * WHERE...I-5 Corridor in Cowlitz County. * WHEN...For the Heat Advisory, from 11 AM Sunday to 5 AM PDT Monday. For the Excessive Heat Watch, from late Sunday night through Thursday evening. * IMPACTS...Extreme heat will significantly increase the potential for heat related illnesses, particularly for those working or participating in outdoor activities.
info.instruction: Monitor the latest forecasts and warnings for updates on this situation. Be prepared to drink plenty of fluids, stay in an air- conditioned room, stay out of the sun, and check up on relatives and neighbors. Young children and pets should never be left unattended in vehicles under any circumstances. This is especially true during warm or hot weather when car interiors can reach lethal temperatures in a matter of minutes.

area.areaDesc: Lower Columbia and I - 5 Corridor in Cowlitz County
